cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles W of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest across Hispaniola and the Bahamas, then turning more north-northwest and skirting the Florida east coast toward Georgia/South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southeast Florida coast (around Palm Beach – Treasure Coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for Florida as of Advisory 8A
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for Florida as of Advisory 8A
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast from Miami to Jacksonville, and northward into coastal Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph, gusts 50 mph) possible Sunday night into Monday as the center passes just offshore
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft surge and minor coastal flooding possible along the lower St. Johns River and adjacent beaches
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated higher amounts could cause localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents affecting port approach channels beginning this weekend
